text: How do I limit a file size when writing to files in python
I am using the output streams from the io module and writing to files.
I want to be able to detect when I have written 1G of data to a file and then start writing to a second file.
I can't seem to figure out how to determine how much data I have written to the file.
Is there something easy built in to io?
Or might I have to count the bytes before each write manually?
